titleStmt.title: The wandring Jew; or, The shoemaker of Jerusalem, who lived when our sauiour [sic] Christ was crucified, and appoynted by him to live untill his comming againe. To the tune of, The ladies fall.
The wandring Jew; or, The shoemaker of Jerusalem, who lived when our sauiour [sic] Christ was crucified, and appoynted by him to live untill his comming againe. To the tune of, The ladies fall.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for E. Wright in Gilt-spur-street.,

notesStmt.note: Right half sheet contains: The second part; to the same tune.
Wing (2nd ed.) suggests date of publication as post 1640.
Reproduction of original in: Bodleian Library.
